Moving object measurements with Gaussian error, Bayes estimate

A particle is moving along a line with unknown initial position $x_0$ and unknown velocity $v$. You need to estimate these paremeters $x_0, v$. You may assume that they both have unit normal prior distributions: You are given a sequence of $10$ measurements of the particle's position at times $t=0,1,\cdots, 9$. Each measurement has a certain error $\epsilon_i$. You may assume that these measurement errors are normally distributed with standard deviation $\sigma = 0.5$, so that

The loss function for your estimate $x_0^\ast, v^\ast$ is and you should minimize the average expected loss of your estimates.

In the below R code:

  • omega is a vector of the $10$ measurements of the particle's position at $t=0,1,\cdots,9$
  • pos0 is your estimate of the particle's initial position
  • vel is your estimate of the particle's velocity
  • decision_fxn should return an R vector of length $2$, with respective entries pos0 and vel

    

    

        
decision_fxn <- function(omega) {
    # Make an estimate for the initial position pos0 and the velocity vel, based on
    #   the measurements in omega
    pos0 <- 0;
    vel <- 0;
    c(pos0, vel)
}


        

            Scoring 
 
            Bronze: 0.3 

            Silver: 0.26 

            Gold: 0.233
